verses.kjv: And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.
verses.ct: As Jesus was walking along, he noticed a man who had been blind since birth.

verses.kjv: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
verses.ct: His disciples asked him, "Teacher, whose sin caused this man to be born blind — his own or his parents'?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "It wasn't because of his sin or his parents' sin. This happened so that God's power could be displayed through him.

verses.kjv: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night cometh, when no man can work.
verses.ct: We have to carry out the work of the one who sent me while there is still daylight. Night is approaching, when no one can work.

verses.kjv: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
verses.ct: For as long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world."

verses.kjv: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
verses.ct: After saying this, he spit on the ground and mixed the saliva with dirt to form mud, then spread it over the blind man's eyes.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.
verses.ct: Then he told him, "Go wash yourself in the pool of Siloam" (the name means "Sent"). So the man went, washed, and came back able to see.

verses.kjv: The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
verses.ct: His neighbors and the people who had previously known him as a blind beggar asked, "Isn't this the same man who used to sit and beg?"

verses.kjv: Some said, This is he: others said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.
verses.ct: Some insisted, "That's him." Others said, "No, he just looks like him." But the man himself declared, "I am the same person."

verses.kjv: Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
verses.ct: So they asked him, "Then how did you gain your sight?"

verses.kjv: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.
verses.ct: He answered, "The man called Jesus made mud, spread it on my eyes, and told me, 'Go to the pool of Siloam and wash.' So I went and washed, and then I could see."

verses.kjv: Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
verses.ct: They asked him, "Where is this man?" He replied, "I don't know."

verses.kjv: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
verses.ct: They brought the formerly blind man to the Pharisees.

verses.kjv: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
verses.ct: Now, the day Jesus had made the mud and restored the man's sight was a Sabbath.

verses.kjv: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
verses.ct: So the Pharisees also questioned him about how he had received his sight. He told them, "He put mud on my eyes, I washed it off, and now I can see."

verses.kjv: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
verses.ct: Some of the Pharisees said, "This man can't be from God because he doesn't observe the Sabbath." But others argued, "How could a sinful person perform such miraculous signs?" So they were divided over the matter.

verses.kjv: They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
verses.ct: They turned back to the blind man and asked, "What is your opinion about him, since he's the one who restored your sight?" He answered, "He is a prophet."

verses.kjv: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
verses.ct: The Jewish leaders still refused to believe that the man had actually been blind and then received his sight, so they summoned his parents.

verses.kjv: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
verses.ct: They questioned them: "Is this your son? Are you claiming he was born blind? If so, how is it that he can see now?"

verses.kjv: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:
verses.ct: His parents responded, "We know for certain that this is our son and that he was born blind.

verses.kjv: But by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.
verses.ct: But how he can see now, we have no idea. And we don't know who restored his sight either. He's an adult — ask him directly. He can answer for himself."

verses.kjv: These words spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
verses.ct: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, who had already decided that anyone who acknowledged Jesus as the Christ would be expelled from the synagogue.

verses.kjv: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.
verses.ct: That's why his parents said, "He's an adult — ask him directly."

verses.kjv: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
verses.ct: So for a 2nd time, they called in the man who had been blind and told him, "Give glory to God by telling the truth. We know that this man is a sinner."

verses.kjv: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.
verses.ct: He replied, "Whether he's a sinner or not, I couldn't say. But here's what I do know: I used to be blind, and now I can see."

verses.kjv: Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
verses.ct: They pressed him again, "What exactly did he do to you? How did he restore your sight?"

verses.kjv: He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear it again? will ye also be his disciples?
verses.ct: He answered, "I already told you, and you didn't listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Are you hoping to become his disciples too?"

verses.kjv: Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses’ disciples.
verses.ct: They hurled insults at him and said, "You're his disciple! We are disciples of Moses.

verses.kjv: We know that God spake unto Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.
verses.ct: We know that God spoke to Moses, but as for this man, we don't even know where he comes from."

verses.kjv: The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
verses.ct: The man responded, "Now that's remarkable! You don't know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.

verses.kjv: Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
verses.ct: Everyone knows that God doesn't listen to sinners, but he does listen to those who worship him and do his will.

verses.kjv: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
verses.ct: Never in all of history has anyone heard of a person restoring sight to someone born blind.

verses.kjv: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
verses.ct: If this man weren't from God, he wouldn't be able to do anything like this."

verses.kjv: They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
verses.ct: They shot back, "You were steeped in sin from the moment you were born, and you're trying to lecture us?" Then they threw him out.

verses.kjv: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
verses.ct: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, and when he found the man, he asked him, "Do you believe in the Son of God?"

verses.kjv: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
verses.ct: The man replied, "Sir, tell me who he is so that I can believe in him."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "You've already seen him. In fact, he's the one speaking with you right now."

verses.kjv: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
verses.ct: The man exclaimed, "Lord, I believe!" And he knelt down and worshipped him.

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.
verses.ct: Then Jesus said, "I came into this world to bring judgment — so that those who are blind will see, and those who think they see will become blind."

verses.kjv: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?
verses.ct: Some Pharisees who were nearby heard this and asked him, "Are you saying that we're blind too?"

verses.kjv: Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "If you were truly blind, you would not be guilty of sin. But since you claim that you can see, your sin remains."
